也許要花很長時間才能找到解決這個問題的辦法。
The solution of the problem requires a lot of time.
解決這個問題需要很多時間。
Salt can be held in solution in water.
She rinsed her mouth with a solution of salt in water.

title: degree
sessions: Water freezes at zero degrees Centigrade.
Our teacher has a high degree of responsibility.
我們老師有高度的責任感。
I agree with you to some degree.
在某種程度上我與你意見一致。
He has just got his M.A. degree.
他剛拿到文學碩士學位。

title: rate
sessions: The unemployment rate is rising in that country.
那個國家的失業率正在上升。
The car was going at the rate of 60 miles an hour.
汽車以每小時六十英里的速度行駛。
The room rates at this motel range from $30 to $50 per day.
這個汽車旅館的房價每天從三十美元到五十美元不等。
She gave her children a first-rate education.
她給她的孩子一流的教育。
How do you rate our chances of success?
你估計我們成功的可能性有多大？
He was rated one of the richest men in Texas.
他被認為是德州最富有的人之一。
That hotel doesn't rate five stars at all.
那家旅館根本夠不上五星級。
Hong Kong rates as one of the biggest trade centers in the world.
香港是世界上最大的貿易中心之一。
The overseas teacher rates with her Chinese colleagues.
那位外籍教師很受中國同事的歡迎。

title: community
sessions: We visited the Chinese community in San Francisco.
我們訪問了舊金山的華人社區。
He did it for the good of the community.
他為了公眾的利益而做這件事。

title: protect
sessions: May God protect you from harm.
願上帝保佑你免受傷害。
Wearing dark glasses can protect your eyes from the sun.
戴墨鏡可以保護眼睛不受陽光刺激。
The insurance policy protects you against injury.
如遭傷害，這保險單保證償付你的損失。

title: usual
sessions: He came home later than usual.
Shall we meet at the usual time and place?
我們在老地方老時間見面好嗎？

title: structure
sessions: We know a lot about the structure of genes now.
如今我們對基因的結構有了較多的了解。
We visited the museum, a steel and glass structure.
我們參觀了博物館，它是一座鋼和玻璃的建築物。

他們建立通訊系統以滿足客戶的需要。

title: favorite
sessions: 特別喜愛的人（或物）；受寵的人，親信
Lester, the second son, was his father's favorite.
二兒子里斯特是他父親的寵兒。
百事可樂是我最喜歡的飲料。

title: accept
sessions: 他已經接受了我們的邀請。
The astronaut accepts danger as being part of the job.
太空人承認他們的工作中包含著危險。
He wouldn't accept that smoking was detrimental to health.
他不相信吸菸有害健康。
I don't accept that the firm will go bankrupt.

title: clear
sessions: 清澈的，透明的；(皮膚) 潔淨的
We could see fish in the clear water.
我們看到清澈的水中有魚。
The night was clear and the stars were out.
夜空晴朗，星星都出來了。
清楚的；清晰的；明瞭的；易懂的
Professor Smith gave a clear explanation of the experiment.
史密斯教授對這次實驗做了清晰的講解。
We had a clear view of the mountains.
He said she was a lady with a clear mind.
他說她是一位思想敏銳的女士。
It is becoming clearer to us that they don't want to do that.
我們越來越清楚地看到他們不願做那件事。
I am not quite clear yet about this.
The road is clear of snow now.
Tuesday afternoon is clear. Shall we meet then?
星期二下午有空，我們在那時見面好嗎？
Now that I've told you everything, I can leave with a clear conscience.
如今我已將一切都告訴了你，我可以問心無愧地走了。 10 (尤指薪資或利潤)
不觸及事物；與某事物有距離 [（+of）]
The plane climbed until it was clear of the clouds.
Allow three clear days for the letter to come.
信要整整三天才能到達。
The ship sank clear to the bottom of the sea.
We usually clear the water with a filter.
我們通常用過濾器使水淨化。
She cleared the leftovers from the table.
她清掉桌上的剩飯剩菜。
洗刷（某人）的嫌疑；為（某人）辯白 [（+of）]
In that case you'll have to clear yourself.
那樣，你只得自行辯白了。
使獲得批准；認可；准予；為（船隻或貨物）結關；通過（海關等） [（+with）]
The plan has cleared the committee.
該計畫已獲委員會批准。
The truck cleared the tunnel safely.
卡車安全地通過了隧道。
David will go there to clear an account.
大衛將到那裡去結清一筆帳。
It takes three days to clear a check.
Mr. Brown cleared a huge profit.
布朗先生淨賺了一大筆利潤。
變乾淨；變清澈；變晴；變清楚

title: public
sessions: You mustn't do that in a public place.
你不可在公共場所做那事。
The public was provoked to anger.
The museum is open to the public.
這個博物館對大眾開放。

title: value
sessions: This dictionary is of little value to you.
這本詞典對你沒有什麼幫助。
The value of the dollar may fall.
This car is good value for your money.
這輛汽車你買得很合算。
他的價值觀念似乎陳舊了。
那只表估計值一百美元。
我估計這條項鍊值五千美元。
My father values honesty beyond all things.
我父親把誠實看得比什麼都重要。

title: will
sessions: He will be home at six.
(表示經常性，習慣性) 經常，慣於，總是
This auditorium will seat one thousand people.
這個禮堂能容納一千人。
This will be the house you're looking for.
這大概就是你找的那所房子了。
(表示責任，義務) 必須，一定
No one will leave the examination room before ten o'clock.
十點以前誰也不能離開考場。
I tried with all my might to will him to say no.
我竭盡全力想使他說不。
He willed his house to his nephew.
他立下遺囑，把房子留給姪子。
吉姆是個意志堅強的人。
He had a strong will to beat his opponent.
他有擊敗對手的強烈慾望。
She had no will of her own.
They bear you no ill will.
In her will she left all her money to her children.
她在遺囑中將其所有的錢留給子女。

title: sound
sessions: 聲音，響聲；【物理學】 聲 [U] [C]
We heard sounds of laughter from the next room.
我們聽到隔壁房間傳來的陣陣笑聲。
The sounds from the next room woke up the child.
隔壁房間傳來的喧鬧聲把孩子弄醒了。
We camped within sound of the sea.
我們在聽得見海濤聲的地方露營。
At this moment his footsteps sounded on the stairs.
這時候傳來了他走在樓梯上的腳步聲。
The music sounds very pleasing to the ear.
這音樂聽起來十分悅耳。
He sounded his horn to warn the other driver.
他按喇叭提醒對方司機。
The bell sounded dismissal early today.
The "b" in "comb" is not sounded. comb這個詞裡的"b"是不發音的。

title: event
sessions: Winning the scholarship was a great event in the boy's life.
贏得這項獎學金是這個男孩一生中的一件大事。
Which events have you entered for?
你參加了哪些比賽項目？

title: allow
sessions: Swimming is not allowed at this beach.
He doesn't allow cats in the room.
Their teacher allowed them three days for the assignment.
他們的老師給他們三天時間完成作業。
The windfall allowed me to buy a house.
這意外之財使我得以購置一幢房子。
He allowed that they were right.
The situation allows of no delay.
情況不容許有任何延誤。
In working with this cloth, be sure to allow for shrinking.
用這種布縫衣，務必考慮到洗後會縮水。

title: major
sessions: 1 (數量大小稱度等) 較大的；較多的；較大範圍的
The major part of the audience was laughing.
重要人物；才能卓越者，地位優越者
Minor poets are legion; the majors are few and far between.
二三流的詩人不計其數；大詩人則寥寥無幾，多少年才出一個。
Are most of you English majors?
你們大多數都是英語主修生嗎？
【音樂】 大調，大音階；大音程；大三和弦
the scale of C major C大調音階
MGM, Paramount, and Columbia are all majors in film industry.
米高梅、派拉蒙和哥倫比亞都是電影業的大公司。
What do you plan to major in?

title: suggest
sessions: I suggest our going to the park on Sunday.
我建議我們星期天去公園。
The dentist suggested that she (should) come another day.
That cloud suggests a boat to me.

title: remain
sessions: A few pears remain on the trees.
Little of the original architecture remains.
原先的建築物幾乎片瓦不留。
She remained in her office all afternoon.
她整個下午沒有離開辦公室。
This room remains cool all summer.
這個房間整個夏天保持涼爽。
Several problems remain to be solved.
有好幾個問題尚待解決。
The decision remains with the general manager.

title: system
sessions: They are devising a road system.
The present system of education needs to be improved.
目前的教育制度需要改進。
他的幾位祕書工作有條不紊。
I prefer this system of teaching English.
我喜歡這一種英語教授方法。
Excessive drinking does harm to the system.

title: count
sessions: They are counting the books they collected.
他們正在數收集來的書。
There are ten people, not counting the guide.
You should count yourself fortunate in having good health.
你身體健康，這就算幸運了。
In sport what really counts is not the winning but the playing.
就運動而言，重要的不是贏，而是參與。
The count showed that twenty thousand votes had been cast.
統計表明已投票兩萬張。
He was found guilty on several counts.
他被發現犯有數種罪行。

title: research
sessions: He is researching into the causes of cancer.
他正在研究癌症的起因。
The historical background to the play has been very carefully researched.
這部劇本的歷史背景已有人作過仔細的研究。

title: several
sessions: He was seriously injured in the accident and died several days later.
他在那次事故中受了重傷，幾天後就死了。
Several of the windows were broken.
有幾扇玻璃窗被砸碎了。

title: cause
sessions: What was the cause of the accident?
造成這一事故的原因是什麼？
You have no cause to complain.
World peace is a cause we should all work for.
爭取世界和平是一項我們都應該為之而努力的事業。
What caused him to quit his job?
是什麼原因使他辭職的？
I'm afraid I'm causing you much trouble.
我怕給你增添很多麻煩。

title: stage
sessions: Some girls are dancing on the stage.
一些女孩在舞臺上跳舞。
戲劇，戲劇藝術；演戲；戲劇界 [the S]
Novels are often adapted for the stage.
A caterpillar must pass through the cocoon stage to become a butterfly.
毛毛蟲必須經過繭的階段才能變成蝴蝶。
該城市正在上演《哈姆雷特》。
They decided to stage a general strike.
這劇本舞臺演出效果甚好。

title: attack
sessions: The enemy attacked our airport all night.
敵人徹夜都在攻擊我們的機場。

州長因沒能履行一項競選時的承諾而受新聞界抨擊。
(努力地) 著手幹；(狼吞虎嚥地) 開始吃
He tried to attack the problem from different angles.
他試著從各個角度來著手解決這個問題。
The planes began their attack on the city.
飛機開始攻擊這個城市。
He's recovering from an attack of flu.
他的流行性感冒快好了。
The little girl has been suffering from an attack of asthma.
那個小女孩的氣喘一再發作。

title: citizen
sessions: The United States gives its citizens certain rights.
美國給予它的公民某些權利。

title: imitate
sessions: I wish you would imitate your brother a little more.
我希望你多學學你的兄弟。
It was some kind of plastic made to imitate iron.
這是一種塑膠，但外觀仿製得像鐵。

title: policy
sessions: One of the new government's policies is to cut taxes.
新政府的政策之一是減稅。

title: role
sessions: She played the leading role in the school play.
她在學校的戲裡扮演主角。
He denied any role in the robbery.
他否認曾參與這起搶劫案。

title: argue
sessions: I'm not going to argue with you tonight.
We argued the matter over for hours.
我們為這事辯論了幾小時。
Columbus argued that the world was round.
哥倫布認為地球是圓形的。

我們說服她不要去作這樣危險的旅行。

title: share
sessions: 一份，份兒；(分擔的) 一部分 [S] [（+in/of）]
I have done my share of the work.
我已經做了我分內的工作。
(工作，費用等的) 分攤；分擔；貢獻 [S]
The young engineer had a large share in modernizing the factory.
這位年輕工程師在工廠現代化的過程中盡了很大的力。
The money was shared out between them.
分享；分擔；共有；共同使用 [（+with/among/between）]
Sam and I share a room.
山姆和我合住一間房間。
My wife shared with me in distress.

title: destroy
sessions: 一場火毀壞了那座房屋。
What he said destroyed our last hope.
他說的話摧毀了我們最後的希望。

title: labor
sessions: All wealth comes ultimately from human labor.
一切財富歸根到底來源於人類的勞動。
The country is short of skilled labor.
這個國家缺乏熟練工人。
He is satisfied with your labors.
他對你幹的活兒很滿意。
She labored ten years on that book.
那本書她足足寫了十年。
He labored in the mines for 30 years.
他在礦場裡辛勤工作了三十年。
The editor labored over the manuscript till early morning.
編輯辛辛苦苦修改稿件直到清晨。
The train labored up the hill.
火車艱難地向山坡上行駛。
Don't labor the point; we all know what you mean.
這一點不用多講了；我們都知道你的意思。

title: situation
sessions: He is in a difficult situation.
The economic situation is now different.
The house has a beautiful situation on a hill.
房子座落在小山上，環境優美。

title: sense
sessions: She has no sense of time.
Your brother has a good sense of humor.
He is free from any sense of responsibility.
He had the good sense to withdraw from the election contest.
The word here is used in its figurative sense.
此詞在這兒取的是它的比喻意義。
Anyone in his right senses wouldn't do that.
神智清醒的人都不會去幹那種事。
What's the sense of arguing with him?
同他爭論有什麼用處呢？
I sensed that I had made a serious mistake.
我意識到自己犯了個嚴重的錯誤。

title: financial
sessions: 財政的；金融的；金融界的
The store was a financial failure and soon closed.
該店賠本，很快就關閉了。
New York is a great financial center.
紐約是一個重要的金融中心。

title: pressure
sessions: The small box was flattened by the pressure of the heavy book on it.
小盒子被這本厚厚的書壓扁了。
他在有壓力的情況下工作很出色。
These old people are unaccustomed to the pressure of modern life.
這些老人不習慣現代生活的緊張壓力。

老式潛艇內的壓力幾乎是難以忍受的。
【美國英語 】 對……施加壓力；迫使 [（+into）] [O2]
Some young people are pressured into staying on at school.
有些年輕人是在壓力下才繼續留在學校裡上學的。

title: charge
sessions: This store often charges only 65 US cents a dozen for large eggs.
一打大雞蛋在這家店裡常常僅賣六角五分。
They charged the enemy three times.
他們向敵人發過三次突擊。
The statement charged that their actions violated the agreement.
聲明指責他們的行為違背了協定。
指示，責令；使承擔責任，委以責任 [O2] [（+with）]
The nurse was charged with the care of the children.
孩子們託付給褓姆照顧。
The battery needs to be charged.
The store doesn't charge for delivery.
The lion charged at those little animals.
獅子向那些小動物衝了過去。
The charge for admission is US$5.
She became her aunt's charge after her mother died.
她母親去世後由姑媽照管。
He was arrested on the charge of robbery.
他因被控犯有搶劫罪而被捕。

title: class
sessions: They hope to win mass support among the middle class.
他們希望能贏得中產階級的廣泛支持。
The class were/was interested in his lecture.
班上學生對他的講座都很感興趣。
Are you in the third-year class?
No talking is allowed during class.
【美國英語 】 (某一年度的) 畢業班 [C] [G]
【口語】 高品質；優異；出色的風度（或外表等） [U]
把……分類；把……分等級；把……歸入某類（或某等級） [（+as/among/with）]
That state is classed as an agricultural area.

title: tax
sessions: The care of six children was a tax on her energies.
照料六個孩子成了她精力上很大的負擔。
A government can tax its citizens directly, and it can tax the property they own.
政府可以直接向公民課稅，也可以對他們的財產課稅。

在光線不好的地方看書會使眼睛很累。

title: firm
sessions: I don't think the chair is firm enough to stand on.
我覺得這椅子不夠穩固，不能站人。
My brother has a firm belief in the value of cold baths.
我的兄弟堅信洗冷水澡有益健康。

這塊濕地不夠堅實，不能在上面走。

她對上帝的信仰堅定不移。
We'll firm up the plan soon.
我們不久就要將這一方案確定下來。

title: union
sessions: We are working for the union of the two countries.
我們正為這兩國的合併而努力。
All the nationalities live together in perfect union.
各族人民非常和睦地生活在一起。

作為獲得該工作的先決條件，他被迫加入了工會。
My paramount object is to save the Union and destroy slavery.
我的最高目標是拯救美國，摧毀奴隸制度。
They married in 1950 but it was not a happy union.
他們於1950年結婚，但這一結合並不美滿。

title: attempt
sessions: They attempted to finish the task before July.
他們試圖在七月以前完成這項任務。
They attempted the life of the dictator.
他們試圖殺死這個獨裁者。
He made an attempt on the world record.

已經有人三番五次試圖謀殺總統。

title: concern
sessions: The letter is chiefly concerned with export commodities.
這封信主要是關於出口商品的。

那男孩健康狀況不佳，使他的父母親憂慮。

He was very concerned about her.
安德魯表示了他的關切。

title: item
sessions: She checked the items in the bill.
她檢查了帳單上的帳目。
(新聞等的) 一則，一條，一項
There was an item in yesterday's paper about the return of the hostages.
昨天的報上有一條關於放回人質的新聞。

title: theory
sessions: Darwin spent more than twenty years working on his theory of evolution.
達爾文花了二十餘年時間研究他的進化論。

理論上它似乎很不錯，但實際上卻行不通。

依我看今年冬天會很冷。

許多科學家接受這樣的看法：宇宙在不斷增大。

title: organization
sessions: 這是一個非營利性的組織。
He is engaged in the organization of a new club.
他正從事於組建一個新的俱樂部。
高效率依賴於良好的組織。
【生物學/生理學/生物化學】 有機體 [C]
The human body is a very complicated organization.
人體是一個非常複雜的有機體。

title: announce
sessions: They announced that she would give one extra song.
他們宣布說她將再唱一首歌。

投票完畢。主席宣布了結果。
通報……的到達；通知……已準備好

一大群人示威抗議暴力壓制。

title: scene
sessions: 景色，景象；(舞臺) 布景 [C]
(事件發生的) 地點，現場；(戲劇等的) 背景 [the S] [（+of）]
The scene of this play is set in Ireland.
這齣戲的場景是在愛爾蘭。
They made a scene of trifles.

title: violence
sessions: The wind blew with great violence.
He flung the door open with violence.
These modern boxlike buildings do violence to the beauty of the old city.
這些現代的盒式建築破壞了古城的美麗市容。

title: challenge
sessions: He received a challenge to a TV debate.
他接到電視辯論的挑戰。
頗有作為的工作；艱鉅的事 [C]
To build a road in the mountainous area was a real challenge.
在山區修築公路確是艱鉅的事。
He wants a career that offers a challenge.
他要有挑戰性，能有一番作為的事業。
(哨兵，警衛等) 查問口令；盤問 [C]
I was met with a challenge when approaching the post.
我在走近哨所時被查問身分。
I challenged him to show his proof.
He challenged my view on that matter.
他就我對那件事的看法提出異議。
The new position challenged him to study still harder during his spare time.
那個新職位激發他在業餘時間更加努力學習。

title: collect
sessions: He's gone to collect his daughter.
Give the speaker a few minutes to collect herself and then begin the programme.
給演講者幾分鐘集中思考一下，然後就開始這項節目。
受話人（或收報人等）付費的
As I had no money with me, I made a collect call.
因為身上沒錢，我打了一個由對方付款的電話。
由受話人（或收報人等）付費
你可以打由我付款的電話給我。

title: dispute
sessions: The two countries disputed for years over a small strip of land on their border.
這兩個國家為了邊界上一塊土地已經爭執多年。
It is ridiculous to dispute about such things.
爭論這類事情真是可笑。
The couple disputed where to spend the holiday.
夫妻倆為上哪兒度假而發生爭論。
他們對選舉結果提出異議。
The two teams were disputing the cup.
The dispute was settled last week.

title: individual
sessions: The director of the factory felt no individual responsibility for the deficit.
廠長個人不覺得應對工廠虧損負責。
Students can apply for individual tuition.
學生可以申請個別授課。
The model has an individual way of dressing.
這個模特兒有著獨特的穿衣方式。
Exceptions can not be made for individuals.

title: mention
sessions: They have three dogs to look after, not to mention the cat and the bird.
他們有三隻狗要照顧，更別提貓和鳥了。
You never mentioned that your wife had had the baby!
你從沒提起你太太已經生了！
When I mentioned what I had come for, he immediately offered to lend me help.
我說明來意之後，他立即提出要幫我忙。
Did you mention this to the boss?
你跟老板提到這事沒有？
Mr. Stevenson was mentioned in the annual report for his cooperation.
史蒂文生先生因樂於合作在年度報告中被提名表揚。
The actor's wedding got a mention in the newspapers.
報上提到了這位演員的婚禮。

title: quality
sessions: Quality often matters more than quantity.
品質往往比數量更重要。
He examined the quality of the furniture carefully.
他仔細檢查傢俱的品質。
One quality of wood is that it can burn.
木料的一個特點是能燃燒。
Modesty is one of his good qualities.
These shoes are made of quality leather.
這些鞋是用高級皮革製成的。
The Times is a quality newspaper.

title: severe
sessions: He has been under a severe strain.
他一直處在極度緊張狀態之中。
My uncle became severe when I was late.
當我遲到時，我的叔父變得嚴厲起來。
I was impressed by his severe reasoning.
他嚴謹的推理給我留下了深刻的印象。
We are suffering from a severe shortage of fuel.
我們苦於嚴重缺乏燃料。
He spoke in a severe voice.
She wore a severe black dress.
她穿一件樸素的黑衣裙。

title: transfer
sessions: She has been transferred to another department.
At the port the goods were transferred onto a ship.
貨物在港口被轉移到一艘船上。
Her father transferred her to a better school.
她父親把她轉到了一所更好的學校。
Within a few years they had transferred barren wastes into fertile fields.
幾年之內他們就把荒地變成了良田。
You transfer the embroidery design from the paper to cloth by pressing it with a warm iron.
你用熱熨斗一燙就把刺繡圖樣轉印到布上。
To preserve the farm intact, he transferred it to one heir.
為了保持這個農場的完整，他將它移交給一個繼承人。
The company has transferred to the west coast.
You can take the subway and then transfer to a bus.
你可先乘捷運然後轉乘公車。
June transferred to an American college in 1990.
瓊在1990年轉學到一所美國的大學。

title: behavior
sessions: He was on his best behavior.
(機器等的) 運轉狀態，性能
The aircraft's behavior was satisfactory on its first test flight.
那架飛機在第一次試飛時運轉情況令人滿意。

title: guarantee
sessions: The TV set has a year's guarantee.
這架電視機有一年的保修期。
You have my guarantee that I'll finish the job on time.
我向你保證按時完成工作。
A diploma is no guarantee of efficiency.
持有文憑不能保證工作效率一定高。
I can offer my land as a guarantee.
我可拿出我的地產作抵押品。
Perfect satisfaction is guaranteed to our customers.
保證我們的顧客完全滿意。
保障，保證……免受損失（或傷害等） [（+against/from）]
The policy guarantees us against all loss.
這種保險契約保障我們免受任何損失。

title: vehicle
sessions: 運載工具；車輛；飛行器；太空火箭
The launch vehicle lifts the satellite into orbit.
太空火箭將人造衛星送入運行軌道。
Language is the vehicle of thought.
語言是表達思想的工具。
(為展露演員才華而) 特意編寫的一齣戲（或電影等） [（+for）]
The play is a good vehicle for his comic talent.
這個劇本很好地展露了他的喜劇天才。
Linseed oil is a vehicle for paint.
亞麻籽油是一種顏料展色劑。

title: approve
sessions: The professor does not approve the government's foreign policy.
那位教授不贊成政府的外交政策。
The city council has now approved the scheme for the erection of a new public library.
市議會業已核准建造一座新的公共圖書館的計畫。
I'm afraid your parents won't approve of your going there.
我擔心你父母不會贊成你到那兒去。

title: relation
sessions: 他們的關係似乎十分密切。
(國家，團體，人等之間的) 關係，往來 [P] [（+between/with）]
They are anxious to develop friendly relations with their neighboring countries.
他們急於同鄰國發展友好關係。
He had no other near relations.
His relation of his adventure fascinated us.
他講述的關於自己的冒險經歷使我們聽入了迷。

title: reserve
sessions: These seats are reserved for special guests.
這些座位是為特別來賓保留的。
We will reserve the money; we may need it later.
我們將把這筆錢存起來，也許以後用得著。
They have reserved rooms at a hotel.
他們已預訂了旅館房間。
I have reserved a table at the restaurant.
我已在飯店預訂了一桌菜。
儲備（物）；儲備金；保留（物）；儲藏量 [C] [U] [（+of）]
The old man kept a large reserve of firewood for cold weather.
這位老人貯存了大量的柴薪以備天冷時用。
克制；沉默寡言；含蓄；冷淡 [U]
預備軍，後備隊；預備役軍人 [P1]
The reserves were quickly mobilized during the war.
戰爭期間後備隊很快動員起來。

title: success
sessions: They have achieved remarkable success in their work.
他們在工作方面成績顯著。
成功的事；取得成就的人 [C]
She was a success as an actress.

title: bomb
sessions: A time bomb exploded twenty minutes after the plane took off.
飛機起飛後二十分鐘一枚定時炸彈爆炸了。
That play turned out to be a total bomb.
The novel was selling like a bomb.
那本小說賣得如火如荼。
The enemy planes bombed the city twice in a week.
敵機一週內對此城轟炸過兩次。
Their new products bombed on the home market.
他們的新產品在國內市場銷售失敗。

title: reject
sessions: The board rejected all our ideas.
董事會拒絕了我們的所有想法。
All apples with soft spots were rejected.
所有帶軟斑點的蘋果都被剔除。
The prisoner's plea for pardon was rejected.
該犯的赦免請求被駁回了。
The patient's body rejected the heart transplant.
病人的身體排斥移植的心臟。

title: victim
sessions: The victims of the explosion were buried last week.
爆炸事故的罹難者於上週舉行了葬禮。
They are the victims of the civil war.

title: block
sessions: 【美國英語 】 (四面圍有街道的) 街區
The store is three blocks away.
There is a block in the pipe and the water can't flow away.
管子裡有阻塞物，水流不出去。
He holds a block of shares.
A piece of rock had fallen and blocked up the path.
一塊岩石掉了下來，堵住了路。
They were blocked from joining the club.
他們被阻加入該俱樂部。

title: complex
sessions: 複雜的，錯綜複雜的；難懂的
A petrochemical complex is to be built here.
這兒將建造一個石油化學聯合企業。
She has a complex about rats.

title: risk
sessions: He saved my life at the risk of losing his own.
他冒著生命危險救了我的性命。
He was ready for any risks.
使遭受危險，以……作為賭注
The brave man risked his life in trying to save the child.
那位勇敢的人冒著生命危險試圖救那孩子。
他們冒著失去工作的風險。
By criticizing her boss, she risked losing her job.
批評老板使她冒丟掉工作之險。
I don't think they will risk holding an election.
我想他們是不會冒風險舉行選舉的。

title: survive
sessions: 在……之後仍然生存，從……中逃生
Only two passengers survived the air-crash.
這次飛機失事只有兩名乘客倖免於死。
比……活得長；喪失（配偶，親人等）
She survived her husband by twenty years.
她丈夫去世後她又活了二十年。

title: evidence
sessions: He was punished for giving false evidence.
他因作偽證而受到懲罰。
There are evidences that somebody has been living here.
有跡象顯示有人一直住在這裡。

title: intend
sessions: He intends his son to manage the company.
他打算讓他兒子經營該公司。
Let's ask her what she intends us to do.
讓我們問她要我們做什麼。
What do you intend to do today?
打算使……（成為）；(為……而) 準備 [H] [（+for/as）] [O2]
That trap is intended for you.
那個圈套是為你而設的。

title: lack
sessions: I don't seem to lack anything.
He can not buy it because of his lack of money.
缺少的東西；需要的東西 [C]
Water is a lack of this region.

title: occasion
sessions: He seized the occasion to invite her home for dinner.
他抓住機會邀請她回家裡吃飯。
Her departure was the occasion of much sadness.
她的離別是令人十分悲傷的起因。
You have no occasion to buy another car.
你沒有必要再買一輛汽車。
His rude behavior occasioned a quarrel.
他的無禮行為引起了一場爭吵。

title: withdraw
sessions: She withdrew her eyes from his smashed right hand.
她移開視線不去看他那隻打爛的右手。
The government withdraws worn out money from use.
政府收回舊幣使之不再流通。
The troops are being gradually withdrawn.
He has decided to withdraw from the competition.

title: suffer
sessions: He suffered many humiliations before he became a football star.
他在成為足球名將前受過許多屈辱。
我不能容忍這種粗魯的舉止。
He suffered from poverty all his life.
My father suffers from high blood pressure.
They suffered a great deal in those days.
這部科學儀器受到嚴重損壞。
他因自己的過錯而受到懲罰。

title: exist
sessions: That word doesn't exist in English.

title: property
sessions: This small house is my only property.
這所小房子是我的唯一財產。
He has several properties in this street.
他在這條街上有幾筆地產。
With the city developing rapidly, property in the center is becoming more expensive.
這個城市發展迅速，市中心的房地產愈來愈貴。
He has a large property in the county.
他在這個縣有一大片地產。
He is studying the medicinal properties of wild plants.
他正在研究野生植物的藥物特性。
There is no property in the seashore.

title: respond
sessions: Has she responded to your letter?
The government has responded to pressure and dropped the proposal.
政府已在壓力下放棄了這一建議。
(對治療等) 有良好反應；(對操縱等) 作出靈敏反應 [（+to）]
The patient is responding well to treatment.
【美國英語 】【法律】 承擔責任 [（+in）]
He responded no to the first question.
他對第一個問題的回答是否定的。

title: spirit
sessions: Fulfilment must be sought through the spirit, not the body or the mind.
人要尋求滿足必須透過心靈，而不是透過身體或是腦子。
They believe that his spirit lives on after death.
他們相信他死後靈魂還活著。
(時代等的) 潮流，精神，風氣 [U]
He embodied the American spirit of optimistic materialism.
他具體表現了美國人樂觀的物質主義精神。
(法律等的) 精神，本意 [the S]
The spirit of a law is more important than its words.
法律的精神比它的具體條文更重要。
Smith finished his tea in very low spirits.
史密斯沒精打采地喝完了茶。
He is a man of spirit.
He said it in a spirit of enmity.
他是懷著敵意說這話的。
He was one of the leading spirits of the revolution.
他是這場革命的領袖之一。
He drinks beer and wine but no spirits.
他喝啤酒和葡萄酒但不喝烈酒。 11
迅速而神祕地帶走；拐走；偷走 [O] [（+away/off）]
The child had been spirited away during the night.
那孩子在夜裡被偷偷地帶走了。

title: secure
sessions: Now my house is secure against burglary.
現在我的房子無被盜竊之危險。
You have made me feel secure.
我們的成功是有把握的。
His place in history is now secure.
他在歷史上的地位現在已經穩固了。
He secured all the windows before he left.
他走之前關緊了所有的窗戶。
Some measures are needed to secure the farmland against shifting sand.
需要採取措施使農田免遭流沙的侵襲。
He secured a position in a store at US$400 a week.
他在一家商店獲得了一份每週四百美元的工作。
His words secured his father's displeasure.
他的話招致他父親的不悅。
It is highly necessary to secure against the dangers of the coming typhoon.
預防即將來臨的颱風的危險很有必要。
You must order your tickets early to secure against disappointment!
你必須早點訂票以免失望！

title: commit
sessions: I committed an error in handling the business.
我在處理這一業務時犯了一個錯誤。
使承擔義務；使作出保證；使表態 [（+to）]
He didn't commit himself to anything.
把……交託給；把……提交給；把……付諸 [（+to）]
The child was committed to the nurse's care.
The judge committed him to ten years' imprisonment.
The company committed most of its profits to building new factories.
公司撥出大部分利潤建造新工廠。

title: escape
sessions: The soldier escaped from the enemy's prison.
這個士兵從敵人的監獄裡逃了出來。
He traveled extensively to escape from boredom.
Gas is escaping from the pipe.
We were lucky to escape being punished.
He escaped the trials after the war.
The matter has quite escaped my memory.
這件事我完全記不得了。
He made his escape in disguise.
Can you smell an escape of gas?
你能聞到漏出的瓦斯嗎？
She read detective stories as an escape.
We must cut off his escape.
我們必須切斷他的退路。

title: remove
sessions: Students removed several desks to another classroom.
學生們把幾張書桌搬到另外一間教室。
She removed the painting to another wall.
她把畫搬到另一面牆上。
She saw he had removed his glasses.
她看到他摘下了他的眼鏡。
He was removed from the post.
The corrupt official was removed from office.
The manager's office has removed to another building.
經理的辦公室已搬到另外一幢大樓裡。
Your action seems several removes from reality.
你的行動似乎有些脫離實際。

title: odd
sessions: 單隻的，不成對的；零散的 [B]
It's no use keeping this odd stocking.
單隻的襪子留著沒什麼用。
Five and nine are odd numbers.
臨時的，不固定的；非經常的 [B]
He does odd jobs for people.
【口語】 (用在數字後) 有零數的，……以上的
She has taught for thirty odd years.
They formed two teams, leaving one odd player.
他們組成兩個球隊，多出一位運動員。

title: alternative
sessions: There was no alternative route open to her.
If you don't like the school lunch, you have the alternative of bringing your own.
要是你不喜歡學校準備的午餐，你可以自己帶飯。
供選擇的東西（或辦法等） [C]
They had no alternative in the matter.
在這件事上，他們沒有選擇的餘地。

title: bill
sessions: The store sent me a bill for $50.
那家商店寄給我一張五十美元的帳單。
The House of Commons has not yet passed the bill.
下議院尚未通過該議案。

title: stuff
sessions: Some parts nowadays are made of plastic or similar stuff.
現在有些零件是由塑膠或類似的材料製造的。
I've got quite a lot of stuff to read.
The young man has good stuff in him.
Get rid of that stuff in the garage.
把車庫裡那些沒有用的東西處理掉。
He has a bad cold and his nose is stuffed up.
他患重感冒，鼻子塞住了。
He stuffed the suitcase with his clothes.

title: recognize
sessions: The policeman recognized her as a pickpocket.
He looked at the envelope and recognized Jenny's handwriting immediately.
他看了看信封，馬上認出是珍妮的筆跡。
Many countries recognized the new government.
許多國家承認了新政府。
I recognized that I had made a mistake.
我認識到自己犯了一個錯誤。
The government recognized his outstanding service by giving him a medal.
政府為他頒贈勛章，以表彰他的卓著功績。
He will not recognize me any longer.
You should wait till the chairman recognizes you.
你應該等到主席准許後才能發言。

title: pack
sessions: The tourist carried a pack on his back.
He used to smoke a pack of cigarettes a day.
他過去經常一天抽一包香菸。
(獵犬，野獸，飛機，艦艇等的) 一群；一隊 [G] [（+of）]
A pack of hounds chased the fox.
What she told you was a pack of lies.
她對你說的話是一派謊言。
裝（箱）；給（某人）將（某物）裝入行李 [（+up）] [O1]
Please don't forget to pack me a razor.
請別忘了給我放一把刮鬚刀進去。
He packed his clothes into a trunk.
We packed the books before we moved.
我們在搬遷前把書本捆好了。
They packed off their little daughter to her aunt's house before leaving for France.
他們去法國前把小女兒送到她姑母家。
Thousands of people packed into the stadium.
成千上萬的人擠近體育館。

title: assume
sessions: 以為；假定為；(想當然地) 認為 [+（that）] [O2] [O8] [O9]
I assumed that he had gone for a stroll.
The prince assumed power when he was only fifteen.
王子在十五歲時就掌權了。
His illness assumed a very grave character.
他的病顯得非常的嚴重。
He assumed a look of surprise.

title: replace
sessions: The brakes have to be replaced.
I will replace the cup I broke.
我願用一個新杯子賠還我打碎的一隻。

title: trust
sessions: I have no trust in him.
Her child was left in my trust for the winter vacation.
她的孩子寒假裡由我照顧。
The jewels will be held in trust for the girl till she is twenty.
女孩的那些首飾將被託管到她二十歲為止。
(因受委託而產生的) 義務，責任 [U]
He pledged to fulfil his trust.
Why do you trust a guy like him?
你為什麼要信任他這樣的傢伙呢？
I can't trust my memory. I'd better write everything down.
我的記性靠不住，最好把什麼都寫下來。
I trust your wife will soon get well.
我相信你太太不久就會痊癒的。
How can I trust the valuable things to her?
我怎麼能夠把貴重的東西託付給她呢？
We always trust in her cautiousness.
我們對她辦事謹慎一向是信賴的。
It won't do to trust to the inspiration of the moment when speaking to such a big audience.
